items.title: Chipotle stock craters as Wall Street grows concerned after company cuts forecast
items.summary: At least five Wall Street analysts have cut their price targets for Chipotle shares after the chain's third-quarter earnings report.

items.title: Amazon earnings: Cloud growth, holiday outlook and layoffs in focus
items.summary: Investors are closely watching growth in Amazon's cloud computing unit, which faces increasing pressure from rivals and artificial intelligence deals.

items.title: Apple reports fourth quarter earnings after the bell
items.summary: The fourth quarter, which runs through the end of September, is the first quarter that includes sales from new iPhone 17 models.

items.title: Delta calls on Congress to immediately end government shutdown, pay air traffic controllers
items.summary: The airline industry is pushing Republicans and Democrats to reopen the government as air traffic controllers work without pay.

items.title: Meta stock drops 10% as heightened AI spending overshadows strong third-quarter results
items.summary: Meta's results raised skepticism over the payoff from its aggressive artificial intelligence spending plans and overshadowed strong results.

items.title: Mortgage rates jump 20 basis points following Fed cut
items.summary: Mortgage rates surged higher after the Federal Reserve cut its benchmark interest rate. The market reacted to comments from the chairman on future cuts.

items.title: Powell forced to stave off uprisings in markets and on his own Fed board as his term ends
items.summary: Powell faces if not the most difficult challenge of his time in office at least the trickiest.

items.title: The biggest takeaways from the Trump-Xi meeting — what the truce covers and what is still unclear
items.summary: President Donald Trump said the rare earths agreement is a one-year deal that will be "very routinely extended as time goes by."

items.title: How the Fed's decision to lower interest rates could widen the generational wealth gap
items.summary: Lowering the federal funds rate typically leads to increases in asset values and may widen wealth gaps in the U.S.

items.title: After the Fed cut interest rates, adjustable-rate mortgages may be 'an underappreciated opportunity,' top advisor says
items.summary: More buyers are turning to adjustable-rate mortgages, which offer lower initial rates than fixed-rate loans. But there are some risks.

items.title: Billionaires are spending big to stop Zohran Mamdani's NYC mayoral bid
items.summary: Bill Ackman, Ronald Lauder, William Lauder, Barry Diller and Dan Loeb have all made large donations to stop Mamdani. So have several non-New Yorkers.

items.title: A 'war room' mentality: How auto giants are battling the Nexperia chip crunch
items.summary: Global automakers are bracing for a potential shortage of automotive semiconductor chips sparked by geopolitical tensions between the U.S. and China.

items.title: Hurricane Melissa set to trigger $150 million Jamaica catastrophe bond to help rebuild
items.summary: The bond, structured by Aon, is designed to help Jamaica rebuild after natural disasters by providing parametric coverage against losses from named storms.

items.title: Shipping sector skeptical Trump's latest trade truce with China will reverse import decline
items.summary: U.S. tariffs on imports from China remain relatively high even after a new trade truce between President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping.

items.title: Alphabet stock jumps 4% after posting strong results, boosting AI spend
items.summary: The strong quarter and a boost in capital spending impressed analysts and solidified Alphabet's position as an AI leader.

items.title: Honeywell's spin-off starts trading — plus, Goldman CEO's outlook on the economy
items.summary: Every weekday, the Investing Club releases the Homestretch; an actionable afternoon update just in time for the last hour of trading.

items.title: Shutdown cost government contractors $12 billion so far, Chamber of Commerce report says
items.summary: The Chamber of Commerce urged Congress to pass a short-term funding bill that would reopen the federal government, which shut down on Oct. 1.

items.title: Roblox stock slips 10% as company expects more spending on safety and infrastructure
items.summary: Roblox is facing multiple lawsuits alleging that the platform enables predators to sexually exploit and abuse underage victims.

items.title: AI companies are downplaying amount of energy and capital they need, Joe Lonsdale says
items.summary: Palantir co-founder and venture capitalist Joe Lonsdale says that execs at AI companies are underselling the resources required to meet their ambitions.

items.title: Analysts think Trump would block a Comcast-WBD deal. Comcast says M&A is 'viable'
items.summary: Comcast's Mike Cavanagh told investors he believes M&A is more "viable than maybe some of the public commentary that's out there."

items.title: We're raising our Eli Lilly price target — what a difference a quarter makes
items.summary: The drugmaker posted a strong third quarter, driven by sales of its popular GLP-1 medications

items.title: Trump administration to limit student loan forgiveness eligibility for some public servants
items.summary: The Trump administration is moving closer to limiting eligibility for the Public Service Loan Forgiveness program.

items.title: Starbucks breaks same-store sales losing streak; CEO Niccol calls it a 'critical moment' in turnaround
items.summary: Under CEO Brian Niccol's leadership, the company has implemented a turnaround strategy focused on bringing the coffee chain back to its roots.
